title: cmd/asm: should reject $name(SB)(reg)
body: I don't know enough about x86 instruction encoding, but the assembler accepts syntax like MOVL foo<>(SB)(AX), AX but it is assembled identically to MOVL foo<>(SB), AX. It seems to me that either it should assemble to something different (not sure what, especially on amd64) or cause an error.
